revised_title: Anatomy and Development of Lepidosteus: A Study on the Structure and Evolution of a Ganoid Fish
tldr: This study by Dr. F. M. Balfour and Mr. W. N. Parker examines the anatomy and development of the Lepidosteus fish, focusing on its unique features such as the large thalamencephalon, divided cerebrum, and suctorial dish. The research also explores the development of its sensory organs, muscular system, vertebral column, and ribs, providing insights into the evolution of ganoid fish.
